hide-info-button.name: Hide info buttons
hide-info-button.description: Hide these small blue info buttons in the lower left corners of the large buttons in editor

move-slider.name: Fix interface overlapping
move-slider.description: This mod adds two extra buttons to editor upper left menu. In some cases they may overlap with a <cg>slider</c>. Enabling this setting will move the slider to the right, which will probably fix the overlapping

control-key-modifier.name: Use 'Ctrl' key as tool modifier
control-key-modifier.description: When enabled, you can hold 'Ctrl' to use the tool

preview-color.name: Color preview
preview-color.description:
This setting, turns off default <cp>pink highlight</c> for selected objects, while using the tool on the <cy>Color trigger</c> or <cy>Pulse trigger</c>. 
(this allows you to preview the actual objects color)

smart-filter.name: Smart Filter
smart-filter.description: Ok, this is a bit complex thing (that's why it's disabled by default). But it is actually really <cy>powerful</c>. Let's say you've selected a bunch of blocks and triggers. By default if you connect them to the (let's say) spawn trigger, no options will be offered to you (because you can't "spawn" the blocks - you can only spawn the triggers). But when the <cg>Smart Filter</c> is enabled you will be offered an options as when selecting only triggers. These options will appear in the menu with the <cy>*</c> sign at the end. Additionally only filtered objects will keep their <cp>pink selection</c> and the tool <cg>will be applied exclusively to them</c>.

show-old-variant.name: Show the 'old' option
show-old-variant.description:
This is an option that allows you to add source objects to the group, that is <cy>currently</c> specified in the trigger you are configuring. This is a very handy option when the trigger already activates a group and you just want to add a new object to this group. 
<co>Note 1:</c> Option will appear in the lower menu under a name 'old' (+groupID).
 <co>Note 2:</c> This setting is disabled by default for less confusion.

default-copy-group.name: Default behavior is copy group
default-copy-group.description:
When the <cb>destination object</c> has no settings to change (for example, if it is a simple block, spike, or some kind of decoration), the tool is not applied by default. But when this setting is enabled, the default action will be an option to copy one of the the <cb>destination object</c> groups to the <cb>source objects</c>.
 <co>Note:</c> <cr>I do not recommend enabling this setting as it is confusing and is not really useful.</c>

fix-next-item-id.name: Fix getNextFreeItemID() behavior
fix-next-item-id.description:
Robtop's implementation of <cg>getNextFreeItemID()</c> function does not take into account item IDs in the count triggers, instant count triggers, edit item triggers and even items themselves:) So I've made a fixed version of it which resolves this issue. 
This is enabled using this setting. 
<co>Note:</c> this change will be exclusive for Triggers Wiring Tool

preview-mode-colorful-lines.name: Colorful lines
preview-mode-colorful-lines.description:
Makes preview mode <cy>c</c><cj>o</c><cg>l</c><cb>o</c>r<cp>f</c><cr>u</c><co>l</c>. Try it! 
<co>Note 1:</c> The color is random, so it may accidentally <cb>blend</c> into the background color or other colors.
<co>Note 2:</c> Color actually depends on the <cy>source objects</c>, so when different triggers affect the same objects, these triggers have the same line color (which is convenient).

preview-all-when-nothing-selected.name: Preview ALL, when nothing is selected
preview-all-when-nothing-selected.description: Show preview for <cy>ALL</c> objects in the level when no specific objects are selected.

keybinds-label.name: Keybinds (read info)
